item.title: LLM-Driven Preference Data Synthesis for Proactive Prediction of the Next User Utterance in Human-Machine Dialogue
item.description: arXiv:2601.09713v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Proactively predicting a users next utterance in human-machine dialogue can streamline interaction and improve user experience. Existing commercial API-based solutions are subject to privacy concerns while deploying general-purpose LLMs locally remain...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, model, research, LLM, API | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Cross-Platform Evaluation of Large Language Model Safety in Pediatric Consultations: Evolution of Adversarial Robustness and the Scale Paradox
item.description: arXiv:2601.09721v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Background Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed in medical consultations, yet their safety under realistic user pressures remains understudied. Prior assessments focused on neutral conditions, overlooking vulnerabilities from anxious...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, arxiv, model, study, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
